text: I pretend to follow them, but stop just before the final step. Something about this place feels wrong—I want a clearer look.
“Wait. Let me take a look at the formation.”
“Don’t—!” Lucia instinctively reaches out to grab me.
I step forward anyway.
The moment my boot touches that thin dark-blue line, the ground feels as if it’s been ‘noticed’—
With a low hum, the remaining formation flares to life for a brief instant.
A chill shoots up from my ankle. My vision blurs, and it sounds as if someone is whispering the same sentence over and over in my ear.
“...What—”
“Don’t touch it.”
The next second, she’s beside me. Her movement is as sharp as a blade of wind.
“Do you want it to remember you?”
“I just wanted to—”
“To know the truth?” She lets out a cold laugh. “The truth bites.”
She yanks me away from the line. The cold instantly recedes, like a tide pulling back.
Lucia’s face has gone pale. “You almost triggered an echo… you would’ve been marked!”
“Marked?”
“Don’t ask.”
Her tone shuts the door completely. Not impatience—restraint, holding something back.
“Move. Back to the inn.”
We rush out of the alley. Snow and fog slam into us, and only then do I realize my back is soaked through.
Lucia supports me the whole way, her voice still shaking. “Don’t push yourself anymore… you’re not like her.”
“Then what is she like?”
Alicia doesn’t turn back. She only leaves us with one line: “Someone who’s been walking for too long.”
The inn’s firelight wraps around us again. The sound of the bolt sliding home feels like finally locking the danger outside.
